Properties

NSMutableDictionary * pointObject

Detailed Description

IMSPointObject represents a point mass in a cartesian coordinate system. It has a state, consisting of a position, velocity and acceleration.

Units are: Position: meters Velocity: meters/second Acceleration: meters/second2

Definition at line 21 of file IMSRPointObject.h.

Member Function Documentation

- (void) computeStateForDeltaTime: (NSTimeInterval)  deltaTime  

Comutes a new state for the point deltaTime into the future. Updates position with the equation: newPosition = currentPosition + currentVelocity * deltaTime + currentAcceleration * deltaTime2 / 2 and velocity becomes: newVelocity = currentVelocity + currentAcceleration * deltaTime

Parameters:
deltaTime An NSTimeInterval value to look into the future. The smaller the interval the more accurate the computation, but the more computing power required.

- (id) initWithPositionX: (double)  positionX
positionY: (double)  positionY
positionZ: (double)  positionZ 

Initializer allowing the user to set values for the initial position. The initial velocity and acceleration are set to 0.0.

Parameters:
positionX The X coordinate of the point, in meters
positionY The Y coordinate of the point, in meters
positionZ The Z coordinate of the point, in meters
Returns:
self

Definition at line 37 of file IMSRPointObject.m.

- (void) updateAccelerationX: (double)  accelerationX
accelerationY: (double)  accelerationY
accelerationZ: (double)  accelerationZ 

Update the acceleration in the coordinate system. Acceleration does not get updated by computeStateForDeltatime: so this is the only way that acceleration changes.

See also:
- computeStateForDeltaTime:
Parameters:
accelerationX The acceleration along the X coordinate, in meters/second2
accelerationY The acceleration along the Y coordinate, in meters/second2
accelerationZ The acceleration along the Z coordinate, in meters/second2

Definition at line 201 of file IMSRPointObject.m.

- (void) updatePositionX: (double)  positionX
positionY: (double)  positionY
positionZ: (double)  positionZ 

Update the point's position in the coordinate system. Normally the position will get updated by computeStateForDeltaTime: but there may be times when this method is needed.

See also:
- computeStateForDeltaTime:
Parameters:
positionX The new X coordinate, in meters.
positionY The new Y coordinate, in meters.
positionZ The new Z coordinate, in meters.

Definition at line 184 of file IMSRPointObject.m.

- (void) updateVelocityX: (double)  velocityX
velocityY: (double)  velocityY
velocityZ: (double)  velocityZ 

Update the point's velocity in the coordinate system. Normally the velocity will get updated by computeStateForDeltaTime: but there may be times when this method is needed.

See also:
- computeStateForDeltaTime:
Parameters:
velocityX The new velocity along the X coordinate, in meters/second.
velocityY The new velocity along the Y coordinate, in meters/second.
velocityZ The new velocithy along the Z coordinate, in meters/second.
